sfpowerkit:auth:login.description: Login to an org using a username/password
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:auth:login -u azlam@sfdc.com -p Xasdax2w2  -a prod
      Authorized to azlam@sfdc.com

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

url.name: url
url.description: URL of the instance to be authenticated, Defaults to Test URL

sfpowerkit:azpipelines:updatevariable.description: Updates a shared variable in the Azure Pipelines
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:azpipelines:updatevariable -u az@devops.com -p pax -k env.consumerkey -v sdassad -i 8
     Successfully updated the variable

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

username.name: username
username.description: Username of the azure pipelines account

key.name: key
key.description: Key of the variable to be updated

value.name: value
value.description: Value of the variable to be updated

id.name: id
id.description: Id of the variale group in which the variable has to be updated

sfpowerkit:org:healthcheck.description: Gets the health details of an org
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:healthcheck  -u myOrg@example.com
  Successfully Retrived the healthstatus of the org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage.description: Gets the apex test coverage details of an org
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:orgcoverage  -u myOrg@example.com
  Successfully Retrieved the Apex Test Coverage of the org XXXX
  coverage:85

sfpowerkit:package:applypatch.description: Retrieves and applies the patch, Useful after a package upgrade in a CD Environment
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:package:applypatch -n customer_picklist -u sandbox
    Preparing Patch
    Deploying Patch with ID  0Af4Y000003Q7GySAK
    Polling for Deployment Status
    Polling for Deployment Status
    Patch customer_picklist Deployed successfully.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the static resource to be patched

sfpowerkit:package:valid.description: Validates a package to check whether it only contains valid metadata as per metadata coverage
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:package:valid -n testPackage
  Now analyzing inspections
Converting package testPackage
Elements supported included in your package testPackage are
[
  "AuraDefinitionBundle",
  "CustomApplication",
  "ApexClass",
  "ContentAsset",
  "WorkflowRule"
]

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

sfpowerkit:profile:merge.description: retrieve profiles from a development environment and merge it with the profile configurations
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:merge -u sandbox
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:merge -f force-app -n "My Profile" -r -u sandbox
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:merge -f "module1, module2, module3" -n "My Profile1, My profile2"  -u sandbox

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

folder.name: folder
folder.description: comma separated list of folders to scan for profiles. If ommited, the folders in the packageDirectories configuration will be used.

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: comma separated list of profiles. If ommited, all the profiles found in the folder(s) will be merged

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: comma separated list of metadata for which the permissions will be retrieved.

sfpowerkit:profile:reconcile.description: cleanup profile configurations to make them compatible with the target org.
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:reconcile  --folder force-app
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:reconcile  --folder force-app,module2,module3 -u sandbox
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:profile:reconcile  -u myscratchorg

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

folder.name: folder
folder.description: the folders to Scan. You can provide a comma separated list of folder. If ommited, the folders listed in the package directories will be used.

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: the profile names that will be reconcile. if ommited, all the profiles components will be reconciled.

sfpowerkit:profile:sync.description: retrieve profiles from the salesforce org with all their configurations. Run this command preferably again the production org. Use the merge equivalent again other type of orgs.
examples: $ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:profile:sync -u prod
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:profile:sync  -f force-app -n "My Profile" -r -u prod
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:source:profile:sync  -f "module1, module2, module3" -n "My Profile1, My profile2"  -u prod

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

folder.name: folder
folder.description: comma separated list of folders to scan for profiles. If ommited, all folders in the package directories will be used.

profilelist.name: profilelist
profilelist.description: comma separated list of profiles. If ommited, all the profiles found in the folder(s) will be synchronized

sfpowerkit:project:diff.description: Generate a subset of the project base on a diff file generated by a git diff --raw command. You can ommit the diff file and provide the revisionFrom and optionally revisionTo insted.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

difffile.name: difffile
difffile.description: Name of the file which shows changes between commits

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.description: Encoding of the file default to utf8

revisionfrom.name: revisionfrom
revisionfrom.description: Revision from wich the diff will be executed. Required if you ommit to provide the diff file parameter.

revisionto.name: revisionto
revisionto.description: Revision to wich the diff will be executed. If you ommit this parameter, the head will be used

output.name: output
output.description: Name of the output folder that will contain the modified files

sfpowerkit:project:test.description: Generate a subset of the project base on a diff file generated by a git diff --raw command. You can ommit the diff file and provide the revisionFrom and optionally revisionTo insted.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

difffile.name: difffile
difffile.description: Name of the file which shows changes between commits

encoding.name: encoding
encoding.description: Encoding of the file default to utf8

revisionfrom.name: revisionfrom
revisionfrom.description: Revision from wich the diff will be executed. Required if you ommit to provide the diff file parameter.

revisionto.name: revisionto
revisionto.description: Revision to wich the diff will be executed. If you ommit this parameter, the head will be used

sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:create.description: Creates a connected app in the target org for JWT based authentication, Please note it only creates Connected App with All users may self authorize option, You would need to manually edit the policies to enable admin users are pre-approved and add your profile to this connected app
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:create -u myOrg@example.com -n AzurePipelines -c id_rsa -e azlam.salamm@invalid.com
  Created Connected App AzurePipelines in Target Org

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the connected app to be created

pathtocertificate.name: pathtocertificate
pathtocertificate.description: Filepath to the private certificate for the connected app to be created

email.name: email
email.description: Email of the connected app to be created

sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:retrieve.description: Retrieves the consumer key for a connected app, Useful after a sandbox refresh in a CD Environment
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:org:connectedapp:retrieve -n AzurePipelines -u azlam@sfdc.com 
  Retrived AzurePipelines Consumer Key : XSD21Sd23123w21321

name.description: Name of the connected app to be retreived

sfpowerkit:org:sandbox:create.description: Creates a sandbox using the tooling api, ensure the user has the required permissions before using this command
examples:
$ sfdx sfpowerkit:org:sandbox:create -d Testsandbox -l DEVELOPER -n test2 -u myOrg@example.com
  Successfully Enqueued Creation of Sandbox

apexclass.description: A reference to the ID of an Apex class that runs after each copy of the sandbox

clonefrom.description: A reference to the ID of a SandboxInfo that serves as the source org for a cloned sandbox.

individualpackage.name: individualpackage
individualpackage.description: Installs a specific package especially for upgrade scenario

installationkeys.name: installationkeys
installationkeys.description: installation key for key-protected packages (format is 1:MyPackage1Key 2: 3:MyPackage3Key... to allow some packages without installation key)

wait.name: wait
wait.description: number of minutes to wait for installation status (also used for publishwait). Default is 10

noprompt.name: noprompt
noprompt.description: allow Remote Site Settings and Content Security Policy websites to send or receive data without confirmation

updateall.name: updateall
updateall.description: Update all packages even if they are installed in the target org

apexcompileonlypackage.name: apexcompileonlypackage
apexcompileonlypackage.description: Compile the apex only in the package, by default only the compilation of the apex in the entire org is triggered

sfpowerkit:source:apextestsuite:convert.description: Converts an apex test suite to its consituent apex classes as a single line separated by commas, so that it can be used for metadata api deployment
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:source:apextestsuite:convert -n MyApexTestSuite 
    "ABC2,ABC1Test"

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

name.name: name
name.description: The name of the apextestsuite (the file name minus the apex test suite)

package.name: package
package.description: The package where the apex test suite exists

pathoverride.name: pathoverride
pathoverride.description: The path to be overriden in case test suite are in a different folder in the target package

sfpowerkit:source:picklist:generatepatch.description: Search picklist fields inside project and create a static resource file with picklist fields, used to solve the picklist upgrade issue in dx unlock package
examples:
$ sfdx  sfpowerkit:source:picklist:generate -p Core -d src/core/main/default/objects/
     Scanning for fields of type picklist
     Found 30 fields of type picklist
     Source was successfully converted to Metadata API format and written to the location: .../temp_sfpowerkit/mdapi
     Generating static resource file : src/core/main/default/staticresources/Core_picklist.resource-meta.xml

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

package.name: package
package.description: Name of the package to generate the picklist patch

objectsdir.name: objectsdir
objectsdir.description: Path for Objects folder located in project
